page.title: 01The Forestry Commission..
page.content: The{Forestry Commission}is a national body controlled by the government.The commission was set up in 1919AD.The function of the{Forestry {Commission}is to co-ordinate the planning and planting of timber-tree plantations in the British Isles so that the country would always have a supply of timber. The land chosen for these plantations is mainly land of little farming value.The soils are often poor and the land often hilly. The plantations contain mostly{ {Coniferous trees},including Scots Pine,corsican Pine,Norway Spruce. In the time that the commission has been established, it has planted more than 600,000 hectacres of new plantations.This has helped to produce about 10 per.cent of the nation's timber requirements.
